neurofeedback-outreach.subject: CS Student Interested in Neurofeedback: Looking for Advice

recipients.title: Professor Young
fill_items: Your work on rtfMRI neurofeedback for depression caught my attention as a promising path.

recipients.title: Professor Siegle
fill_items: Moreover, your focus on PTSD and dissociation is the closest to my interests that I've found.

recipients.title: Professor Collinger
fill_items: Moreover, your work on brain-computer interfaces for restoring function is deeply inspiring to me.

recipients.title: Professor Schwartz
fill_items: Moreover, your pioneering BCI research with paralyzed patients is extremely exciting to me.

recipients.title: Professor Batista
fill_items: Moreover, your research on the neural constraints of learning is something that I'd love to understand as best I can.

recipients.title: Dr. Gaunt
fill_items: Your work on restoring sensation through brain stimulation represents the kind of restorative technology I'd love to help develop or change people lives with.

recipients.title: Professor Yu
fill_items: Moreover, your research on how internal states affect learning through BCIs fascinates me.

recipients.title: Professor Chase
fill_items: Your work on neurofeedback strategies for motor learning has clear therapeutic implications that I'd love to explore.

recipients.title: Professor Weber
fill_items: Your work on neuroplasticity training is something fundamental that I'd love to begin to understand.

recipients.title: Professor Just
fill_items: Your fMRI research on thought identification could inform the basis for therapeutic approaches.

recipients.title: Professor Verstynen
fill_items: Your research on skill learning and neural pathways is in an area I'd love to understand better.

recipients.title: Professor Wehbe
fill_items: Moreover, as an AI major, your machine learning approaches to understanding brain activity are highly relevant for me.

recipients.title: Professor Smith
fill_items: Your work on visual perception and neural population coding is compelling and closely related.

recipients.title: Professor Barth
fill_items: Your research on neural plasticity and how experience transforms neurons is directly relevant to what I want to understand.

recipients.title: Professor Tsay
fill_items: Your work on motor learning and rehabilitation applications is inspiring and deeply related.

recipients.title: Professor Phillips
fill_items: Your neuroimaging work on mood disorders and emotion regulation is highly relevant; it would be amazing to get the chance to discuss it.

recipients.title: Professor Luna
fill_items: Your research on adolescent brain development and psychiatric vulnerability is fascinating and deeply related.

recipients.title: Professor Gianaros
fill_items: Moreover, your work on stress, brain activity, and cardiovascular health gives me hope that you might have insights of your own on how to advance this field.

recipients.title: Professor Ahmari
fill_items: Your research on neural mechanisms of compulsive behavior is fascinating and deeply relevant to neurofeedback.

recipients.title: Professor Grace
fill_items: Your work on basal ganglia and psychiatric disorders has been foundational to the field, and I'd love to discuss it with you sometime.

recipients.title: Professor Fiez
fill_items: Your neuroimaging research on language, working memory, and learning is deeply related to how trauma might impact the brain.

recipients.title: Professor Ladouceur
fill_items: Your work on emotional development and anxiety in adolescents has strong intersections.

recipients.title: Professor Tarr
fill_items: Your cognitive neuroscience research on perception and brain science is impressive and deeply related.

recipients.title: Professor Lee
fill_items: Your computational neuroscience work bridges neuroscience and AI, my major, in fascinating ways.

recipients.title: Professor Mahon
fill_items: Your research on brain organization and recovery from injury is highly relevant to this field.

recipients.title: Professor Plaut
fill_items: Your computational modeling of neural basis of cognition is highly relevant to this field.

recipients.title: Professor Pitkow
fill_items: Your theoretical neuroscience work on neural computation is foundational and something I'd love to learn more about.

recipients.title: Professor Vyas
fill_items: Moreover, your work on neural dynamics and brain-computer interfaces is highly relevant to this field, and something I'd love to learn more about.

recipients.title: Professor Yttri
fill_items: Your research on neural circuits underlying behavior is highly relevant.
